Johnson  Department of Cinema Studies      CALL #: 75722      Monday 12:30PM  - 4:30PM      This course provides an historical  overview of moviegoing, from the earliest exhibitions of Lumiere’s  cinematograph to the live streaming of films on the Internet. The course is  structured chronologically, starting with early cinema practices and the ―nickelodeon‖  era, moving through the picture palace and multiplex eras, and ending with  Global Hollywood and transmedia practices. Topics to be addressed include the  impact of new technology on film exhibition and moviegoing, art house cinema  and film festivals, international and non-theatrical film exhibition, fan  culture, cinephilia and film memories.
